title: If a musician's work is on Spotify, do they get paid? - Quora

response.answer_text: They don’t. Technically, yes - SOME money is made. But I’ll show you what I earned on one October day in 2018 from Spotify. Search “Clay Mottley” and “Clay Mottley Band” to hear these songs for yourself. (I’d appreciate it!) In My Town - 2 streams - $0.0071 for a total of $0.0142Say Stay - 1 stream - $0.0071 for a total of $0.0071Lack of Explanation - 1 stream - $0.0071 for a total of $0.0071Nothing’s Ever Really Gone - 8 streams - $0.0029 for a total of $0.0229Little Child of Mine - 2 streams - $0.0002 for a total of $0.0003Little Child of Mine - 1 stream - $0.0016 for a total of $0.0016Brother - 1 stream - $0.0029 for a total of $0.0029Long Way Left to Go - 1 stream - $0.0016 for a total of $0.0016Leading Me On - 1 stream - $0.0071 for a total of $0.0071What I Call Life - 1 stream - $0.0048 for a total of $0.0048 For a grand total of 19 streams earning 7 American pennies (rounded UP to 7!). You may also notice some of the amounts are different, even for the same song. I can assure you they are exactly copied from my accounting page. I double-checked, and there are no typos. Bottom line - streaming services are fantastic tools to getting music out there. But as long as they are giving them away for free, or for nearly free, there is no money to be made in streaming by the artists.

I cannot speak for all artists, but I am an independent artists with six solo piano albums and several singles on Spotify, mostly due to being registered on cdbaby. I am happy to report that these songs are streamed about 1 million times per year (total, not each) and that Spotify pays roughly 1/10th or 2/10ths of a cent per stream. That is a nice revenue stream for a completely unknown artist as myself. I am streamed significantly more than that on Pandora, which pays about the same or slightly more. Also relative newcomer’s Apple Music and Amazon Premium pay as much as 7/10ths Of a penny per stream, but their volume is nowhere near-yet-that of Pandora and Spotify.
